basics.name: adminUsername
basics.label: VM Admin User Name
basics.toolTip: The name of the Admin User for initial SSH access to all OCP Nodes.

constraints.validationMessage: Only alphanumeric characters and dashes are allowed, and the value must be 1-31 characters long.

label.sshPublicKey: SSH Public Key for VM Admin User

toolTip.sshPublicKey: SSH Public Key for the VM Admin User. Corresponds to the Private Key in the Key Vault that was configured as part of the pre-work.

elements.name: openshiftClusterPrefix
elements.label: OCP Cluster Name Prefix
elements.toolTip: The Prefix for the name of the OCP Nodes. Must be between 1 and 20 characters.

constraints.validationMessage: Only alphanumeric characters are allowed, and the value must be 1-20 characters long.

elements.name: masterVmSize
elements.label: Master Node Size
elements.toolTip: The size of management nodes deployed in the OpenShift cluster.

elements.name: infraVmSize
elements.label: Infrastructure Node Size
elements.toolTip: The size of infrastructure nodes deployed in the OpenShift cluster.

elements.name: nodeInstanceCount
elements.label: Number of Application Nodes
elements.toolTip: Select number of Application Nodes to be created in the OpenShift cluster

constraints.validationMessage: Select a number between one and nine for the number of application nodes. More can be added after the cluster is created.

elements.name: nodeVmSize
elements.label: Application Node Size
elements.toolTip: The size of nodes deployed to run applications in the OpenShift cluster.

elements.name: bastionVmSize
elements.label: Bastion Host Size
elements.toolTip: The size of bastion host used to access and deploy the OpenShift cluster.

elements.name: defaultOrCustomVNet
elements.label: New or Existing Virtual Network
elements.toolTip: By defaut new will bet setup with subnets in the 10.0.0.0/14 range. If you chose existing you will need to have both the name of the existing Virtual Network and the resource group it is in.

elements.name: virtualNetworkResourceGroupName
elements.label: Resource Group for the existing Virtual Network

elements.name: customIPrange
elements.label: Chosing the default or to customize the Virtual Network
elements.toolTip: The default VirtualNetwork this offer will create subnets use IPs in the range 10.0.0.0/14 range.

elements.name: addressPrefixes
elements.label: Address Range for the VirtualNetwork (default is 10.0.0.0/14)
elements.toolTip: Has to be an RFC 1918 address and will contain the master and node subnets.

elements.name: masterSubnetPrefix
elements.label: Address Range for the subnet containing the master, infra, and cns nodes (default is 10.1.0.0/16)
elements.toolTip: Needs to be at least 16 IP addresses and be follow RFC 1918.

elements.name: infraSubnetPrefix
elements.label: Address Range for the subnet containing all the infrastructure nodes (default is 10.2.0.0/16)
elements.toolTip: Needs to be at least 32 IP addresses and be follow RFC 1918.

elements.name: nodeSubnetPrefix
elements.label: Address Range for the subnet containing all the cns and compute nodes (default is 10.3.0.0/16)
elements.toolTip: Needs to be at least 32 IP addresses and be follow RFC 1918.

elements.name: keyVaultResourceGroup
elements.label: Key Vault Resource Group Name
elements.toolTip: Name of the Resource Group that contains the Key Vault used to store the Private Key.

constraints.validationMessage: Only alphanumeric characters, underscores, and dashes are allowed.

elements.name: keyVaultName
elements.label: Key Vault Name
elements.toolTip: Name of the Key Vault that contains the Secret used to store the Private Key.

constraints.validationMessage: Only alphanumeric characters and dashes are allowed, and has to be between 3 and 24 characters.

elements.name: keyVaultSecret
elements.label: Secret Name
elements.toolTip: Name of the Secret that contains the Private Key.

constraints.validationMessage: Only alphanumeric characters and dashes are allowed.

elements.name: openshiftPassword
elements.toolTip: Password for the OpenShift Admin User - not the VM Admin User.

elements.name: rhsmUsername
elements.label: Red Hat Subscription Manager User Name
elements.toolTip: User Name to access your Red Hat Subscription - access.redhat.com. This is used to register the RHEL instance to your subscription and will not be stored by Microsoft or Red Hat.

constraints.validationMessage: Red Hat Subscription usernames need to be 5 or more characters.

elements.name: rhsmPassword

label.password: Red Hat Subscription Manager User Password

elements.toolTip: Password to access your Red Hat Subscription - access.redhat.com. This is used to register the RHEL instance to your subscription and will not be stored by Microsoft or Red Hat.

elements.name: rhsmPoolId
elements.label: Red Hat Subscription Manager OpenShift Pool ID
elements.toolTip: The Pool ID that contains OpenShift Container Platform entitlement. Ensure you have enough entitlements of OpenShift Container Platform for the installation of the cluster.

constraints.validationMessage: Pool IDs can only contain hexadecimal values.

elements.name: rhsmBrokerPoolId
elements.label: Red Hat Subscription Manager OpenShift Pool ID for Broker / Master Nodes
elements.toolTip: Red Hat Subscription Manager Pool ID with OpenShift entitlements for Broker / Master Nodes. If not using this, enter the Pool ID for Application Nodes. To find it, run on registered server: subscription-manager list

constraints.validationMessage: Pool IDs can only contain hexadecimal values.

elements.name: enableAzure
elements.label: Configure Azure Cloud Provider
elements.toolTip: Configure OpenShift to use Azure Cloud Provider. Necessary if using Azure disk attach for persistent volumes.

elements.name: aadClientId
elements.label: Azure AD Service Principal Client ID GUID
elements.toolTip: Azure AD Service Principal Client ID GUID - also known as AppID.

elements.name: aadClientSecret

label.password: Azure AD Service Principal Client ID Secret

elements.toolTip: Azure AD Service Principal Client ID Secret.

elements.name: enableCNS
elements.label: Configure Container Native Storage (CNS)
elements.toolTip: Installs CNS in the OpenShift cluster and enable it as storage. Will be default if Azure Provider is disabled.

elements.name: cnsVmSize
elements.label: CNS Node Size
elements.toolTip: The size of nodes used to host Cloud Native Storage in the OpenShift cluster.

elements.name: enableLogging
elements.label: Configure Cluster Logging
elements.toolTip: Installs Logging functionality into the cluster.

elements.name: enableMetrics
elements.label: Configure Metrics for the Cluster
elements.toolTip: Installs metrics into the OpenShift cluster.

elements.name: defaultSubDomainType
elements.label: Default Router Subdomain
elements.toolTip: Select xipio for testing or custom to enter your own subdomain for production.

elements.name: defaultSubDomain
elements.label: Enter your custom subdomain
elements.toolTip: The custom subdomain to expose applications.
